title: U.S. stock futures about flat after giving up early-session gains
text: U.S. stock futures surrendered early-session gains late Thursday, and were last about flat following slight gains earlier in the day by the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite.

title: Day Trading Surges In Popularity, This Won’t End Well
text: Research is clear that most of the new crop of day traders will end up losing money.

title: Charts suggest new highs 'could be on the table' for the S&P 500, Jim Cramer says
text: "If the S&P 500 really does surge to 3,400, up 9.1% from these levels, maybe take something off the table," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Ryan Worch: This Is Why The Historic Market Recovery Is Just The Beginning
text: Ryan Worch of Worch Capital joined the podcast this week to discuss the historic market recovery and why he thinks we’re still at the beginning of a new bull market.

title: Jim Cramer: 10 bull markets on Wall Street and the stocks leading the way
text: In the last few weeks, more and more groups have switched from bear market territory to bull market territory and they've still got plenty of room to play catch up, the "Mad Money" host said.

text: The AdvisorShares Ranger Equity Bear ETF's David Tice is worried the impact of the Federal Reserve's unprecedented policies and speculative investing.

text: It's not the Robinhood Crowd that's keeping the stock market indexes lofty. It's the pros that are on the outside looking in.

title: SoFi CEO says it may send warnings to users who might be day trading about the risks
text: "We're taking the responsibility seriously, whether it's margin lending or options or investing in cryptocurrency, to make sure these are the right products for our members for the long term," SoFi CEO Anthony Noto told CNBC.

title: Stock futures rise slightly as Wall Street tries to end the week on a high note
text: Futures rose following a muted session in which traders grappled with disappointing unemployment data and rising coronavirus cases.

title: US Indexes Close Mostly Flat Thursday (June 18)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 26,080.10 on Thursday with a loss of 39.51 points or -0.15%.

text: Lindsey Piegza, Stifel chief economist, on what loan data says about consumer strength.

text: With the U.S. stock market sending mixed signals, market watchers are keeping tabs on the rate of the economic recovery.

text: The V-shaped recovery seems well underway, but Commonwealth CIO Brad McMillan says there are reasons to be concerned about where the market is now.

text: Biogen (BIIB), Kroger (KR) among some of the day's more notable moves

title: The Next Iteration of Monetary Policy Could Be Yield Curve Control
text: Debt and interest rates have become the predominant driving force of our economy. Unfortunately, a majority of the debt is unproductive, resulting in declining long-run economic and productivity growth rates.

title: Trump says U.S. has option of 'decoupling' from China, contradicting his trade chief
text: President Donald Trump on Thursday said the U.S. has the option of "a complete decoupling from China," a day after his top trade adviser said such a move isn't a reasonable policy.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Thursday (June 18)
text: Disappointing unemployment data and rising coronavirus cases dampened Wall Street sentiment on Thursday.

title: Stocks close mixed as coronavirus cases show no let-up
text: U.S. stocks closed mixed to mostly higher Thursday as investors struggled to digest concerns about job losses from coronavirus lockdowns and rising case counts.

title: S&P 500 closes nominally higher amid COVID-19 spikes, muted data
text: The S&P 500 closed nominally higher on Thursday as investors weighed a resurgence in coronavirus infections and the possibility of a new round of shutdowns as well as data that suggested the U.S. economy might not bounce back with quick, V-shaped recovery.

title: Does The U.S. Economy Need More Stimulating?
text: If the U.S. economy is going to rebound from a profound suffering, it must invest in the clean tech economy.

title: Barstools Sports founder: Sports gambling, day trading are ‘not very different’
text: Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy talks to FOX Business’ Charles Payne about day trading and if sports will return.

title: Prejudice is bad for the economy... as we enter the 4th industrial revolution: UBS Paul Donovan
text: UBS Chief Economist Paul Donavan breaks down what the Title 7 and the DACA  ruling from the Supreme Court means for labor mobility and the economy.

title: Goldman Sees ‘Clear Signs Of Recovery’ In 2020, But Says These Risks Remain
text: The Wall Street firm predicts a “more rapid recovery” in the second half of the year.

title: Hedge funds and REITS slash leverage, says Fed survey
text: The Federal Reserve said that the share of hedge funds and real estate investment trusts (REITs) cutting their use of leverage was the highest since 2011, according to a survey of banks and broker-dealers.

title: Serious Challenges Ahead for the Dollar:  Berkeley's Eichengreen
text: Barry Eichengreen, Professor of Economics and Political Science at Berkeley, says the Federal Reserve has reinforced the U.S. dollar. He appears on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Oil futures climb as OPEC+ makes moves to compensate for overproduction
text: Oil futures settled higher on Thursday after major producers at an OPEC-led meeting of the Joint Ministerial Monitoring Committee, or JMMC, stressed the importance of full compliance with pledged production cuts, and made moves to ensure that certain countries make up for failing to fully meet their output targets last month.

title: $190 oil sounds crazy. But JPMorgan thinks it's possible, even after the pandemic
text: In a little-noticed report, JPMorgan Chase warned in early March that the oil market could be on the cusp of a "supercycle" that sends Brent crude skyrocketing as high as $190 a barrel in 2025.

title: These Two Biotech IPOs Showing Signs Of Healthy Public Market Debut
text: The initial public offerings of two biotechnology companies, Repair Therapeutics and Forma Therapeutics, are showing signs of a strong debut. They price this evening and will trade Friday.

title: Jobless claims down for 11th straight week as 1.5 million file for unemployment for the week ending
text: The number of jobs lost due to the coronavirus shutdown continue to mount, with the latest weekly total of Americans applying for unemployment benefits coming in above 1.5 million, yet again.

title: Gold futures end lower, but stick to a tight trading range
text: Gold futures finished lower on Thursday, contributing to a loss so far this week but sticking to the tight trading range that's been in place over the past couple of months.

title: S&P 500 muted as virus cases rise, jobless claims weigh
text: The S&P 500 was little changed on Thursday as coronavirus infections picked up again in parts of the United States and data showed an elevated level of weekly jobless claims, lending weight to predictions of a prolonged economic recovery.

title: U.S. labor market improvement stalling; second wave of layoffs seen
text: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits fell last week, but the pace of decline has stalled amid a second wave of layoffs as companies battle weak demand and fractured supply chains, supporting views that the economy faces a long and difficult recovery from the COVID-19 recession.

title: U.S. Pulls Out Of Talks With EU Over Taxing Big Tech
text: The U.S. government has suspended negotiations on the issue of digital taxes on American tech companies and has threatened to impose tariffs on countries who implement the tax.

text: Some people seem to be making easy money by gambling on short-term swings in stock prices, but beware -- the math is not in your favor.

text: Buying Call options allows an investor to expand their market exposure beyond what buying stocks directly or using margin can do.

title: Technology, medical and pharmaceutical has caught the attention of these high-net worth investors
text: High-net worth investors in the investment group TIGER 21 have been waiting for a crisis and it finally came. These individuals have been stockpiling cash for the last year and they continue to do so.

title: DoorDash valued at $16 billion in pre-IPO funding round
text: DoorDash said here on Thursday it was looking to raise about $400 million from investors, valuing the food delivery company at about $16 billion ahead of its initial public offering. The company, backed by SoftBank Group, filed here for an IPO in February, setting it up as one of the most high-profile listings of 2020.

title: Mohnish Pabrai on Using Value Investing to Outperform the Market
text: The S&P 500’s recent volatility has confirmed that it is impossible to accurately predict the stock market’s movements, in my view.

title: M&A Experts: Credit Markets are Open, Expect a Busy 2021
text: Despite the unprecedented global uncertainty, credit markets remain open for business and have proven to be robust enough to provide access to capital to some of the riskiest borrowers in need. What’s also surprising amid this economic disruption is that we’re also seeing record levels of cash on US corporate balance sheets coupled with pent-up [.

title: Oil edges up on OPEC output cut compliance; pandemic still weighs
text: Oil prices rose slightly Thursday as a panel of OPEC and its allies met to review record oil supply cuts, even as the market remained concerned about additional coronavirus cases reported in parts of the United States and China.
